name: Barometz
description: The Barometz is a large plant creature with a connection to the land, characterized by its ability to sprout nourishing fruits upon its death.
memorable: It can provide significant benefits to those who consume its nourishing fruits, granting the effects of a heroes’ feast spell.
goals: To thrive in its ecosystem and possibly aid those who utilize its fruits.
relations: Can be encountered near parent trees connected by vines.
strengths: Regenerates health at the start of its turn and is resistant to several forms of damage.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to slashing damage and loses regenerative capabilities if its connection to the parent vine is severed.
attacks: Can perform a multiattack using both gore and hooves, dealing piercing and bludgeoning damage.
most_powerful_ability: Fruit of the Land allows it to grant the benefits of a heroes’ feast spell upon its death.
additional_information: Resistant to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Immunities to exhaustion and the poisoned condition.
Can pass through difficult terrain and magical plants without penalty.
Has a unique connection to a Parent Vine affecting its regeneration abilities.
The fruit created cannot last long, requiring timely consumption.
